intro: Cabanisia paradoxa, commonly known as the paradoxical cabanisia, is a rare and enigmatic plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its unique, fern-like foliage. The plant produces small, white flowers that bloom in clusters, adding to its ornamental appeal. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern. Its botanical study offers insights into adaptive strategies of plants in extreme environments.
